data.title: Tank Calendar — The Tank
data.text:
The Armory Improv House Teams

Rambunctious, daring, hilarious, provoking, and fun. Trust us - You've never experienced a night of improvisation quite like this.

View Event →

The Benny Winner Show

Since he was a young boy, Benny Winner dreamed of hosting his own talk show, like his heroes Jerry Springer, Steve Wilkos, and Maury Povich.

View Event →

it's been ten years since everyone died

three people are forcibly reunited at a therapeutical retreat to heal their inner little girl, while dealing with the horror movie traumas of their pasts: it's a final girl play.

View Event →

KARA & EMMA & BARBARA & MIRANDA

August 2, 3, 4, 8, 9, 10, 15, 16, 17 at 7:00 PM

KARA & EMMA & BARBARA & MIRANDA is a play about four women whose major life crises collide on Christmas Eve, leading them to accidentally help each other find a way out.

View Event →

Split Bill (Brat Green): Progressive Family Play & Are The Cis Okay?

Progressive Family Play

After coming out as transgender, Hayden confronts his extended family at a holiday gathering.

Are The Cis Okay?

“Are the Cis Okay?” is a ~Very~ dramatic play Daring to ask the question: “[see title of play]”. A council of trans, gender nonconforming and gender expansive people gather in a super secret gender-inclusive undisclosed location to determine whether or not the cis are “okay,” and should the cis NOT be okay, the council must collectively and unanimously decide what punishment shall be bestowed upon the cis for cis crimes against greater humanity (say “cis” again).

View Event →

Overeager

Enchanted by false promises of success and sisterhood, a lonely college dropout joins a pyramid scheme and discovers it amplifies her problems for profit.

View Event →

SPLIT BILL (Emerald): Roses Are Red, Violets Soir Bleu + roundandround

Through a surrealist lens, we meet our clown and prostitute, fumbling through the realities of making new friends. Deep down, we’re all seeking connection…and maybe a fake cigarette or two.

roundandround is a one-woman embodied movement piece created by Sadie Pillion-Gardner about the cyclical nature of grief. Catch the performance at The Tank August 8th at 9:30pm and August 18th at 3pm.

View Event →

Unholy Horizon

1606, London. Four people in constant conflict with who they are versus who they long to be. Even then, they were willing to do whatever it takes.

View Event →

tā 祂

tā 祂 is a sci-fi queer solo performance set in a Rick & Morty like garage laboratory, except it’s a mother and her offspring this time, who may or may not exist in the same timeline.

View Event →

Sublimation

In the 20th century, two female chemists, Dr. Bechtol, and her student, Dr. Carr, create a weapon of mass destruction in a private lab, navigating their growing attraction amidst escalating global, ethical, and personal dilemmas. Meanwhile, the course of their careers and relationship takes a transformative turn when they discover Alberta, a talking decontamination shower, who unveils startling visions of the future.

View Event →

The Third Hunger, or The Donner Party Play

The year is 1846, and the girls are girling. Also, they’re eating people. But Frances and Patty won’t eat each other - not yet. The Third Hunger is the story of the infamous Donner Party expedition, told from the shrewd perspective of some of its youngest members.

Featuring Healy Knight, Mackenzie Moyer & Sarah Groustra

Directed by Abby Davis

View Event →

Funeral Party

When their friend Eliza is murdered, a group of friends take a trip to mourn, but their lakeside retreat is interrupted by a viral zombie outbreak.

View Event →

Spew's Little Baby

A dark, queer love story told through the tangling of bodies, classes, and species, Spew’s Little Baby examines desire and its power to spark life, unleash decay… or both.

View Event →

A Vulva Named Carol

A woman explodes, splattering her parts all over Hollywood. Her ghost discovers her vulva (a sassy vape-smoking muppet named Carol) on an IN-N-OUT sign who helps her understand why…

View Event →

The Word of the Day

Set in Vermont in 1991, 25-year-old famous linguist Nicolet Diana is trapped in her apartment on house arrest for a crime she didn't commit.

View Event →

Sam and Kiki's Big Gay Road Trip

When best friends, Sam and Kiki, embark from Texas on the lesbian road trip of their dreams, shenanigans and insecurities threaten their chances of reaching New England liberal arts paradise.

View Event →

Squishy Emotional Insides

The seniors of the Ruby Valley High School Jaguars Marching Band, victims of an elementary school shooting in 2006, navigate life after traumatic adolescence. Written by Mehrnaz Tiv and directed by Sabina Sethi Unni, This group dromedy explores being a band kid geek and trauma and gun violence in America.

View Event →

If You Want

Loosely based on "As You Like It," "If You Want" tells the story of best high school friends Rosa, Celia, and Stone, who stumble upon their Arden, a fantastical green world where they find themselves free, loved, and full of joie de vivre. But can they stay in this world forever?

View Event →

SPLIT BILL (Evergreen): Eat of Me + Clown Pimp

Attending Catholic high school as a teenage girl in the early 2000s is Moira’s perfect recipe for ecstasy. The secret ingredient? A dead body. And she can’t wait to eat.

A struggling, first-generation college student named Leti considers becoming a party clown to pay her bills. But before she does that, she has to meet her clown pimp.

View Event →

Brace Yourself

Brace Yourself is an original pop-rock musical following Holly and her friends on a quest to find her orthodontist and get her braces off during the apocalypse.

View Event →

Prudence Play

Prudence Play is a new play about a young nun who’s having unholy (horny) dreams. In confession and in her diary, she’s only just starting to admit the truth.

View Event →

Train Song

Four rocks sit on the tracks. The earth is hot. The beasts return. Cycles repeat. The Train rumbles by asking, “What if the scariest thing in the woods is you?”

View Event →

Jenny's Doll Hospital

Jenny's Doll Hospital is an experimental chamber musical about devotion, brokenness, and just how much of ourselves we will (or should) sacrifice to heal the one we love.

View Event →

Oversteegen

Oversteegen is a story about sisterhood, resilience, and resistance.

View Event →

Illegal Alien

An Alien lands in the Middle of Trinidad Carnival and discovers all sorts of Vibes!

View Event →

Hamlet on the Run

A one-hour comedic version of William Shakespeare’s tragic play, Hamlet on the Run. Seven actors play twenty-four characters in one hour. It’s the play we all know but shorter.

View Event →

Ghetto Alchemy Anniversary Celebration

Join us for the year anniversary celebration of Ghetto Alchemy: Vol 1! This exciting evening will feature live performances , a special visual screening, and a freestyle session OTA.

View Event →

Boutonnière: A Drama On Queer Themes

The night before their wedding, Max and Josh must practice their first dance as a married couple. As the clock ticks and wine is poured, their impending union brings up old traumas, secrets, and shame.

View Event →

Girls Just Wanna Commit Domestic Terrorism

Four college students embark on a road trip across post-Roe America to avenge the trauma of their explosive and charismatic leader, but the friend group fractures as secrets emerge.

View Event →

Actual Throat

Fiona finds a metal arm in the woods. She starts having dreams about it. They're not sex dreams, exactly.

View Event →

Point to Point

How do you go from a single point in space to the largest object in the universe and back to a single point, when you're surrounded by existential dread?

View Event →

The Frontera Series

The Frontera Series is a play reading series dedicated to highlighting the next frontier of great American Playwrights.

View Event →

Heaven Is A Place in the Sky

Geoff's lonely. His girlfriend Juliet hires actors to pose as his friends. Whitney's in love with Juliet. The therapist they all go to keeps trying to hang out?

View Event →

The Last Podcast on Earth

Set against the backdrop of an apocalyptic world unraveling under the weight of late-stage capitalism, the play explores the complexities of female friendship, fame, and the absurdities of our digital age.

View Event →

Vile Isle

In seven days the world will end by Flood—at least according to drag queen Lizzie Fine, who receives a frightening prophecy of Old Testament proportions. Meanwhile, a gaggle of gay "chosen family" considers unchoosing each other. Nathan the Demon Twink seeks transcendence through Kabbalah (and Adderall), Christopher bravely transitions (into a DJ), and Gnocchi the Cat WILL be Bat Mitzvah'd, God willing. Vile Isle is a precocious and party-fueled dark comedy about how we fail and forgive one another and what faith is worth when our limits are existentially tested.

View Event →

NURSE!

Juliet’s Nurse hits the road to correct the record on "the greatest love story ever told." Love! Death! Aging! Teenagers!

View Event →

Ivories

Haunted prodigal playwright Sloane and their botanist husband Gwyn are due to settle the estate of Sloane's ailing grandmother. When Gwyn's childhood friend Beckham arrives to help the couple bury the hatchet, they soon discover there may be more to the dusty old house, and to Sloane's twisted past, hidden beneath the foundation.

View Event →

Haunt Me

Tier5's SpookyFest staged reading series kicks off with Justin McDevitt's gay ghost story, Haunt Me.

View Event →

The Last Grain of Rice

Bill’s Rice, a restaurant that serves only rice, runs out of rice. With a tempting business proposition and a vengeful ferret, the owners must navigate love, legacy, and letting go.

View Event →

A Wild.Mess Production

A Wild.Mess Production will present a collection of works by rogue wave and wild.DANCE. The evening will consist of a variety of pieces that accentuate the unique and exciting voices of choreographers/directors Catherine Messina and Emmy Wildermuth.

View Event →

Dracula: Blood & Glitter

Tier5's SpookyFest staged reading series continues with James Cougar Canfield's DRACULA: BLOOD & GLITTER.

View Event →

V from Vitality

Minnie has just started a wonderful new job. The pay is great, the job is easy, but the catch is it will drain the blood out of her if she isn't careful.

View Event →

scars & stains (a frankenstein adaptation or dream)

Tier5 finishes its SpookyFest staged reading series with Matilda Corley Schulman's scars & stains!

View Event →

A Chimera, A Prayer

What do you believe in next when the Wizard is just a bald man behind a curtain?

View Event →

Arrivederci

Experience Annie Brown's "Arrivederci" at The Tank. Inspired by true stories, this staged reading explores love, loss, and self-discovery in Italy. Don't miss this captivating evening!

View Event →

TRUE CRIME

When the brutal murder of college student Nancy’s roommate becomes the subject of her favorite true crime podcast, Nancy’s beloved pastime turns into a waking nightmare she can’t escape.

View Event →

revelations from the first and last ever rehearsal of THEY SAY I DID SOMETHING BAD...

An edgy playwright creates a new musical about the Unabomber. Featuring Ecoterrorist Taylor, queer romance, rape culture, and the search for tenderness at the end of the world.

View Event →

Pitbull's Party at the End

Pitbull takes the stage at his final New Years Eve concert. Think Miami, think Jewish Cubans, think apocalypse, and mangroves.

View Event →

Manifest Destiny

Manifest Destiny takes place on the ocean floor during the American war on Asia. Laura, an Asian-American pacifist, suddenly develops supernatural powers and must decide her place in the War.

View Event →

SPLIT BILL (Pistachio): Who the Water Carries + The Slate

In the last blue-green home before the delta becomes sea, we hum to you a puppeted fable for the occupied and displaced.

View Event →

BUG

Ada refuses to leave her apartment. A bug becomes something new. And one-million bugs scurry across the stage. Ada and Bug attempt to figure out what the hell anything means.

View Event →

SPLIT BILL (Sage): How To Take A Sh*t In The Union Square Barnes & Noble + Verity Sits In Her Apartment

Three bookish women in their 20s visit the Union Square Barnes & Noble for some retail therapy. What follows is an exploration of female friendship in your 20s and what it means to be a book lover.

View Event →

Take me Ghost Pipe Grove

On an island where each inhabitant works a job related to death, the Epitaph Engraver embarks on a quest to save their mother’s life after learning she will die at sunrise.

View Event →

SPLIT BILL (Jade): Almost Hot + Sextasy

ALMOST HOT is a slightly deranged and absolutely earnest solo show that explores of one of our most potent cultural values: hotness.

A playwright and producer collide over a play that explores the subjects of love, sex, S&M and fantasy. Can they reach an agreement? Or is it a tale of revenge?.

View Event →

3 White Guys Named John

The fantastical and true story of how John Hughes, John Mayer and Jon Bon Jovi inspired Andrea to go where she needed to go thereby altering her life.

View Event →

Who'd Love Lucy?

In Who’d Love Lucy? the titular “crazy girl” recounts heartbreaks that led her to a sticky situation, seeking advice about skeletons in her closet. Who’d love a girl with a hit-list?

View Event →

4 Black Virgins Walk Into A Bar

A comedy about law school, politics and hot sauce centering black women. After a night of arguments, vandalism and dry chicken will four black women walk into a bar together?

View Event →

I Wasn't Planning on Saying Anything

I WASN’T PLANNING ON SAYING ANYTHING follows Min and Kit who, upon returning home for their sibling’s wedding, find themselves struggling to write a toast no one asked them to give.

View Event →

Pretty Good, Not Bad

An unflinching take on the roles we play to survive and living to tell the tale.

View Event →

FREE! TONIGHT!

When a white lie alters the trajectory of three teenagers' tenuous sisterhood while on the NYC subway, FREE! TONIGHT!! dives through the looking glass to question the privilege and belonging of Asian New Yorkers.

View Event →

Best In Show

A group of girls enter their boyfriends into a dog show. Which couple will win Best In Show?

View Event →

Fiestas Ajenas // Other People's Parties

Fiestas Ajenas // Other People’s Parties is a one woman horror/comedy/cooking show. But Really its a dinner party, for you.

View Event →

Mommy

Amy and her vicious daughter Tatum have a tumultuous relationship. When Tatum’s new best friend Briar becomes close with Amy, Tatum sees their new relationship as a threat.

View Event →

OPEN

Come “Open” up about hookup culture, oral sex, and dating on the internet!

View Event →

Por Lo Que Soy

A Chicane woman prepares to meet her father in prison after 14 years. She must embark on a journey of memories to prepare to confront her biggest fear.

View Event →

$7 Girl

Mae West has been a gold star transsexual whore their entire life. Now, they’re moving on- but not without one hell of an erotic, unhinged, audacious swan song.

View Event →

Find My Friends

A location play about privacy and trust in modern relationships, Find My Friends asks us to consider what it means when technology interferes with our interpersonal relationships and our sense of self.

View Event →

Manic Pixie Dream Girl

Scott, a self-described playwright, meets his muse in young poetry student Eva. While crafting what he thinks will be his masterpiece around this new love interest, Eva's personality rebels.

View Event →

GROSS

In a Louisiana mobile home park, friends Wren and Lylah face changes in their friendship as a crashing star brings them together, sparking the exploration of identity and expectations.

View Event →

Split Bill (Olive): The Slate & Eat of Me

The Slate

This could totally be the last play in the world. Or at least it feels like it. It’s 2054 in a post-American world and the show must go on. Right?

Eat of Me

Attending Catholic high school as a teenage girl in the early 2000s is Moira’s perfect recipe for ecstasy. The secret ingredient? A dead body. And she can’t wait to eat.

View Event →

Girls! Girls! Girls!

A play about stripp--I mean, a play about accountants. 'Girls! Girls! Girls!' takes you on a baby stripper’s journey as she enters a whole new world.

View Event →
